text: not sure what you mean by “costume class.” can you explain?

I ended up using <@U7SL518D6>’s idea documented at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/github-integration#write-your-files-to-be-run-on-deploy>.

I made a generate-config.js file that writes out HubSpot.config.yml, then ran the script from Jenkins.

It works, but is awkward, and I’m kind of embarrassed to show it to my manager.

I would recommend that HubSpot consider a way to use environment variables directly for CLI credentials. Using environment variables could be optional, but CI/CD is not optional for modern development. HubSpot.config.yml is fine for local development, though.

Here’s how AWS does it, <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-envvars.html>
